conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the path the liquid will take from each entry point (A, B, C, and D) through the baffles.
A, B, C, D are entry points at the top.
The baffles are the colored bars inside the black area.
The liquid from A flows down and encounters the black baffle.

premise: The liquid from A flows down and encounters the black baffle.
conclusion: The liquid from A is directed towards the left side.

premise: The liquid from A is directed towards the left side.
conclusion: The liquid from A flows into container E.
The liquid from B flows down and encounters the black baffle.

premise: The liquid from B flows down and encounters the black baffle.
conclusion: The liquid from B is directed towards the left side.

premise: The liquid from B is directed towards the left side.
conclusion: The liquid from B flows into container E.
The liquid from C flows down and encounters the red baffle.

premise: The liquid from C flows down and encounters the red baffle.
conclusion: The liquid from C is directed towards the right side.

premise: The liquid from C is directed towards the right side.
conclusion: The liquid from C flows into container F.
The liquid from D flows down and encounters the purple baffle.

premise: The liquid from D flows down and encounters the purple baffle.
conclusion: The liquid from D is directed towards the right side.

premise: The liquid from D is directed towards the right side.
conclusion: The liquid from D flows into container F.

premise: Liquids from A and B flow into container E. Liquids from C and D flow into container F.
conclusion: Container E will receive liquid from A and B. Container F will receive liquid from C and D.
